inn1.comm: a forward defensive to start the game, first time Both is opening the bowling
Gayle gets forward and tucks a quicker delivery towards square leg, West Indies are away

the Botha move has worked wonders, dangerman Gayle is gone, a length delivery pitching outside off, turns away from Gayle who looks to play on the leg side, but only manages to edge it to first slip, where Kallis takes a low catch, what a start for South Africa, Smith and Co are jubilant as Shakira's football anthem "Waka waka" blares round the ground
Darren Bravo defends his first ball on the front foot
that's a wide down the lg side
more defence from Bravo

a referral for lbw, South Africa are hugely confident, Taufel isn't, they take a long time discussing whether to take the referral, they finally do, that pitched outside off and turned in to head towards the middle of middle, Botha was dead-certain that was out, but the replays show Bravo was struck just outside off, great call from Taufel, and what an over that was from Botha
starts with a quick delivery shaping in, tucked to the leg side by Smith
getting the ball to shape in a bit to the left-handers, Bravo bravely walks across to clip that to square leg
short of length ball heading for leg stump, again Bravo looks to whip it towards the leg side, can't connect with it and is struck on the thigh pad
Steyn's been very straight this over, this time he slides down leg and Bravo just needs to get bat on that to send it scurrying for four
better line from Steyn, pitching outside off and coming in, nicely negotiated by Bravo, who works it past point for a couple
that's an expensive over from Steyn, once more he targets the pads, Bravo confidently shuffles across and flicks that behind square leg for four, superb timing
gets forward and eases it to cover
short cover does the fielding this time
blocked towards point this time by Smith
tossed up by Botha, not very often one can say that, turns a touch, Smith tucks it to the leg side
nice stride forward as he defends square on the off side
gets across and taps the ball towards square leg, there's a sharp single on offer, 'Robbie' screams AB asking the fielder to fire the ball in, but Smith completes the run well in time
Steyn keeps it full, this time just outside off, defended to the off side
slightly shorter, and on middle stump this time, Bravo gets well behind the line and blocks down the track, the bugle sounds and the crowd responds
that one didn't get up as much as Bravo expected, it was angling across him after pitching short of a length, gets the bottom-edge and rolls to the off side
again it is outside off, and Bravo guides the ball towards backward point
short of a length again, 140.3kmh, on middle and off, solidly defended towards cover
too straight from Steyn again, he gets away with it though,  as Bravo works it off his pads towards square leg, straight at the fielder
not much room on offer for Smith, but he loves to cut and he plays it well, making a bit of room to crack the ball behind backward point for four
played a touch uppishly, off the back foot towards Morkel at long-on, a quick single is taken
Bravo defends off the front foot
this time the West Indians opt against risking a single to Morkel, it was powerfully struck by Bravo and was straight at the fielder
they do get the single to long-on this ball, Bravo worked the ball a few yards to the left of Morkel
Both sticks to attacking leg stump, nurdled towards square leg by Smith, and there's some indecision whether to go for the single
Steyn starts the over with a back of length ball on middle and leg, defended off the back foot by Bravo
Bravo shows why he's so highly rated, a bit of width from Steyn and Bravo punishes that with panache, stabs it through cover for four
defends this one from Steyn, who gets it closer to the stumps
148.5kmh, great pace but no so great line, way down leg
length ball outside off, Bravo gets well forward and guides the ball towards backward point
short of length ball, West Indies are judging the singles well, Bravo plays it with soft hands towards extra cover and sets off
length ball that was heading for the top of middle, Smith, who had barely faced Steyn today, jumps and blocks it to the leg side
starts with a length ball angling into the batsman, who defends to the leg side
back of length ball heading down leg, looks to flick that but it is off the pad and trickles behind square leg
length ball in the channel outside off, batsman shoulders arms
and once more Smith tries and ungainly clip, but fails to connect, struck on the pad and the ball dribbles towards square leg
Morkel working up some good pace here, 146.1kmh, Smith again shows how much he likes the cut, first ball that allowed him to free his arms and he throws his bat at it, doesn't connect again
fuller ball outside off, Smith opts against playing a stroke
and what a welcome he gets, disdain from Bravo as he flat bats a not so short ball over wide mid-on, emphatic!
chopped towards backward point
what a shot from Bravo, a length ball and Bravo dismisses that one towards wide long-off, dismissive
and once more Bravo looks to smash Kallis, he doesn't quite get hold of it and spoons the ball beyond mid-off, this is one confident young man
targets the off stump this time, defended by Bravo down the track

is there going to be another referral? that looked to be going down the leg side, and South Africa decide against it, that ball jagged back sharply from back of a length and Smith was struck in front of middle and leg, replays show that would have taken leg stump
opens the face to send it to the right of backward point
Bravo inside edges this one off the back foot towards square leg
length ball outside off, punched towards mid-off, thinks of taking a single but a loud 'No' keeps him in the crease
steers this one down to third man for an easy single
the extra bounce that is Morne Morkel's calling card, terrific line as well just outside off, the batsman has to drops his wrists and arch backwards to avoid that one
a quieter start to this Kallis over, blocked off the front foot towards extra cover
full and sliding into leg, Smith stays in the crease and eases the ball towards midwicket for a single
length ball just outside off, Bravo is content to open the face and get the ball down to third man for a single
Kallis keeps nagging around off, Bravo plays it towards backward point, and a flurry of screaming from the batsmen before it was decided to not go for the single
bangs in the bouncer, Kallis showing no signs of the side strain that kept him out of the India one-dayers, Smith goes for the pull but doesn't connect
a far less action-packed Kallis over comes to an end, Smith defends
length ball angling in from Morkel, defended by Bravo
wider outside off, Bravo stabs the ball towards point, but can't beat the fielder
looks to drive that one elegantly through off, but ends up edging it towards midwicket
short of length from Morkel, tentatively pushed by Smith towards cover off the front foot
Smith shows his mastery of the cut, bit of width from Morkel and he chops that behind backward point for four, nicely done, only 56m to that boundary
length ball on off to end the over, punched towards mid-on by Smith
angling in to the batsman, who makes a bit of room and guides the ball behind backward point to bring up the half-century
dabbed down to third man, not much room from Kallis but the batsman just waited on it and guided it down

can't think of a more contrasting shot to the previous one, this one is a murderous pull in front of square, Bravo doesn't rate Kallis as a bowler it seems, the fifty stand is up, Kallis won't be bowling too many short balls to Bravo from now
back to nudging it down to third man, just a bit of width and an easy single is taken
Smith doesn't bother himself with niceties like footwork, as he gropes outside off, sends the ball towards backward point
cramps the batsman up with the leg stump line, awkwardly played towards mid-on, 'Yeah, yeah' is the call and a single is taken
pushed towards mid-on this time, but too close to the fielder to risk a run
on the pads, clipped behind square leg for a single
opens the face to get the ball towards backward point, doesn't beat the fielder
another dot ball, a strange (non) shot from Bravo, a length ball heading for off and Bravo just hangs his bat and edges it, ball drops dead

a dirty slog from Bravo, four dot balls had tested his patience, well outside off but doesn't deter Bravo from looking to swipe it over mid-on, doesn't connect as well as he would have liked, but still gets enough to get a boundary
well outside off, Bravo is happy to shoulder arms after getting a boundary
flatter delivery, on a length on offstump, worked towards midwicket
action is slightly reminiscent of Mushtaq Ahmed, defended back down the pitch
a google from Tahir, more careful defence from Smith
fuller ball, watchful defence from Smith, is there a big hit coming?
long stride in as he defends to the leg side
this one is slightly outside off, worked towards point, that's another dot ball and a good start to Tahir's international career
Bravo races along to 47, a length ball, Bravo was nowhere near the pitch of the ball and he lashes that down the ground for four
down the leg side this time
ooh, that one beat the outside edge, Morkel switches to his patented short-of-length, gets the ball to jump from there, just outside off, Bravo looks to defend from the crease and he is beaten
and again, that was 148kmh, the ball angles away a touch after pitching short of length, Bravo once more plays inside the line, he admonished himself for getting beaten

a tight run, Bravo dabs the ball towards short cover, and sets off, faf du Plessis swoops on to that and throws even as he is diving, hits the stumps at the keeper's end, third umpire is called for, Smith has  made his ground though
keeps it short of length, pegging away at the offstump, Smith jumps as he defends to the leg side

lovely fielding from Robin Peterson stops a gorgeous drive from Bravo, he may have been beaten a couple of times this over but that wasn't playng on his mind as he unleashed a punch towards extra cover, Peterson was quickly across, diving to stop that from racing away for four
fifty for Bravo, and a stylish shot to bring it up, times the ball through covers off the front foot to pick up a couple
guides the ball down to third man for two more

what a shot that is, Bravo spotted the mid-on in the circle, Bravo swings that one powerfully over mid-on, bottom hand comes off as he plays that length delivery, that doesn't matter, it still has the legs to clear the rope, Tahir not having a very good second over, he's under pressure now
driven all along the ground to long-on this time
length ball outside off, pushed towards short cover by Smith
Tahir moves across to his right to cut that push from Smith
looks to guide that toward third man but is beaten outside off
length ball just outside off, poked towards point for a well0-run single
another safe single towards point
punched back towards the bowler
length ball on off, walks across and whips it towards mid-on
overpitched, and Bravo forces that down to long-on for a single to end the over
slants the first one down the leg side, past the glance, and concedes a wide
grip and turn from back of a length, Bravo goes back and whips it away through mid on
tossed up and defended down the track to the off side
on the pads and Smith squirts it away behind square, but can't get the gap
tight delivery, flat and straight, defended down the track
looks to cut this time as Botha gives him a hint of width, and Smith can't get the gap as he cuts
he gets a single and SA won't mind Smith retaining strike. Short delivery on the pads, worked through square for a single
tossed up outside off, Smith leans out and defends to the off side for one
flat and turning in from off stump, Darren defends down the track
this one skids through, Bravo gets it away to short third man off the outside edge

well-played Smith - he's been getting tied down, and responds with a riskfree loft to a delivery bowled on a length and turning in. He chips out and just plays through the line, timed efficiently for four over the bowler's head. Almost a six.
looks to nurdle from outside off behind square for a single, but can't get it away

more confidence from Smith, gets a flighted half-volley outside off and he gets forward decisively to the pitch of it and drives it along the ground for a couple to deep extra cover. South Africa are sweating.
flighted on middle and straightening, perfect forward defensive from the clone
drifts too straight this time, Bravo gets inside the line and works it through midwicket for a single
over-pitched to Smith, who again looks for a big drive, but can't get the gap. Single to long off
Bravo leans back and punches with the spin through the covers as it turns away. No problems at all.
Smith gets forward and pokes at one on middle and leg, gets it safely to the leg side for a single
this pair has added 100. Bravo stays back to a back of length ball and cuts it to the right of cover for another single. Carry on, troopers!
flighted on off, Bravo gets forward and defends to the off side
marginally back of a length, Bravo leans out and guides it square for another single
turning in from outside off, Smith gets inside the line and whips it behind square for another single
Bravo comes down the track, can't get to the pitch and hence defends back down the track
he advances again, Petersen holds it back once more and Bravo responds with the defensive shot to the off side
gets the front foot across this time and turns him with a flourish of the wrists, to play the ball down. Single to wide mid on

tight run thing, but Bravo makes it, since Petersen can't hit the stumps. Smith defends backward of point and Bravo calls him across. Petersen ran in, picked up well and threw, but missed. AB had to collect and break the stumps, enough time for Bravo to hustle in.
short ball, Bravo leans back emphatically - very decisive feet - and gets a couple into the covers
short again, looks for the cut but can't get it past the infield
perfect middle overs batting this. He gets one on the pads and turns it through square leg, ensuring he doesn't over-hit it, and picks up two before the fielder in the deep can come in and field
Bravo comes out and looks to score down the ground, but Botha gets across and fields
again, Botha fields to the off side this time as Bravo defends a back of length ball
tight line on middle and off, played back to the bowler
the sequence of dots is broken as Smith drives uppishly through mid off for a single
Bravo comes out of the crease again, but can't get to the pitch and opens the face to steer a single backward of point
Smith steals two now with soft hands. On the pads, and he whips it through square leg for a couple
better line, keeps it on middle and leg, Smith looks for the flick again, but plays to the bowler
lovely armer to end the over, Smith did not pick it as he leant out on off stump line and looked to defend. It zipped past the outside edge.

Darren Bravo reviews an lbw appeal. Botha tossed this one up on off stump, and it seemed to hold its line. Not much turn. Bravo looked to flick and missed. The ball was thudding into middle and leg. He's played all around a straight one. He knew it was a poor shot the moment he played it. He kicked the turf in disgust before consulting with Smith, and going for the referral reluctantly. No luck there. Huge wicket for SA. Lara's clone has not scored a 100 against them and SA will breathe easy.
spins in big from outside off, Sarwan looks to work it square, but can't find the gap
again Sarwan tries to turn him with the spin through the leg side, and gets a single through midwicket
Smith leans out to the pitch of the ball and drives fluently down to long off for one
Sarwan pushes the front foot down the track and defends into the off side with bat and pad close together
slows it up in the air and gets it to grip and turn into Sarwan who stays back and defends into the off side
full and quick on middle and off, worked with the wrists through wide mid on for one
this one holds its line and skids across on off stump line, Sarwan stays on the crease and defends.
Sarwan stays back again and opens the wrists to get a single into the covers

Mystery man strikes. No mystery in that ball, just old-fashioned flight and guile. Smith walked into the trap with his eyes closed. He would have been feeling a little uneasy ever since Bravo left, they were working well as a pair. Tahir looped this invitingly outside off, Smith reached out, almost got to the pitch but not quite. He ended up chipping it right back to Tahir, who hurls it up in the air after pouching it. More interestingly, he kisses the SA badge. SA are coming back into this.
Chanders reaches out and turns it from middle and off through midwicket for one.
Sarwan comes forward and covers the line as Tahir gets one to turn away prodigiously. Defended in the end.
whoa, what happened there? Steyn lands it back of a length a foot outside off, Chanders decides to let it go, but it just rolls along at ankle height.
on middle and leg this time, Chanders gets into a tangle as he looks to play it to the on side
looks to flick again as Steyn keeps it straight and back of a length. Can't get it away this time either.
Chanders gets inside the line and works it from outside off through backward square leg for one
140.2 kph, attempted bouncer, Steyn must be bemused. In Durban that would have thudded into AB's gloves stretched upwards. Here it goes down as soon as it goes up and AB collects it low down.
on Sarwan's pads this time, very pacy and he nudges it disconcertingly into the leg side for a single

Sarwan reviews an lbw now, against Tahir. What's happening here! My initial gut feel was not out. Here's what happened - Tahir tossed this up and the replay says it landed on leg stump. It then turned a touch, enough to ensure it was going to hit the stumps. Sarwan looked to play with a straight bat, but just missed it. Was there an inside edge? It was going to hit the top of middle, so the decision is upheld. Sarwan is gone and WI are out of reviews.  He was really well forward, and if Taufel had said not out, I doubt if SA would have referred it. Tahir was ecstactic, ran around like a man possessed when it was given first up. Again - was there an edge? The replays are inconclusive. We need HotSpot for it. We don't have it.
and a googly now, don't think Dwayne Bravo picked it as he looked to defend off the front foot. Single through the leg side
Shiv leans out and nurdles with the spin through midwicket for a single
Bravo leans out and defends as Tahir decieves him in the air. He's looking good here.

Tahir's dropped a return chance! Again, sucks Bravo into the drive with a tossed-up delivery, again gets it to drop on him much further than he expected. Bravo was too far into the drive to hold back and chipped it back down the track, but Tahir's follow through takes him to the off side at an angle. He tried to stop and pluck it with his right hand as he tumbled, but it did not stick.
Bravo is at sea at the moment, leans out and somehow gets bat on it as he looks to defend down the track
back of a length outside off, Chanders stays back and looks to force to the off side
similar delivery from round the wicket, Chanders pokes it out from the crease towards the covers
short delivery outside off, Chanders looks to steer it backward of square and can't find the gap
lively stuff from Steyn, jars this in from wide of the crease at 148 kph, and a shuffling Shiv is up to the task as he spots the variation in length and pushes through wide mid off for one
holds this one back and hits the deck hard, Bravo wisely plays the 148 kph zipper off the back foot into the off side
this time he slips one down the leg side and it is called a wide
ends the over with a full sucker delivery at 145.6 kph, it is almost too fast to suck Bravo in. He only manages to defend down the track
another wrong 'un, again Chanders gropes inside the line of the delivery and gets an outside edge backward of point
Chanders gets across to the pitch this time, smothers the spin and plays to the off side
leans out, mindful of the fielder close in and works it to the leg side
gets the single this time, leans out, closes the face and gets it square for one
he jumps out in hope, can't get to the pitch and feebly poked it back down the track. Almost another return catch, but so badly timed that it did not carry.
short of a length outside off, Bravo stays on the crease and tries to force into the off side
speared on leg stump, Bravo stays back and tickles it backward of square for one
back of a length and turning in, Shiv reaches out and defends though he can't get to the pitch
short of a length again and turning into the pads, worked square for one
on the pads, Bravo tries to flick through midwicket, but straight to the fielder
Bravo shuffles across and looks to glance fine, but short fine leg is in the way

ends the over with another huge lbw appeal, this time it is turned down. Speared in on leg and straightening, but I doubt itwas doing enough to hit the stumps as Bravo looked to work it to the leg side. Runs off the pad towards square leg
Bravo is cornered, and he bares his fangs. A rare poor delivery from Tahir, dropped halfway down the track and sitting up like a lollypop. Bravo would up and brutalised it over midwicket for a six.
fuller and on off stump, much faster too, Bravo pushes into the off side and turns the strike
Shiv leans out and drives a full delivery on off stump wide of mid off for a single
Bravo tries to get inside the line and work it fine, but gets some pad on it for a leg bye towards short fine leg
tossed up on off, Shiv pokes into the off side and gets a single.
on off stump this time, pushes away off the front foot into the covers
Robin gets this to turn from middle and off, Bravo opens the face and plays into the off side
on the pads this time, Bravo tries to turn it against the spin but can't get it away
this time he gets the single, driven fluently through mid on for one
slows this up in the air, Shiv nearly chips one back now as he tries to get forward and work to the leg side
gets the single away backward of square leg, worked off the pads nicely
Bravo does likewise, quietly dabbing him off the pads through backward square leg for a single

Bravo! He's had his problems against spin, but in between that he's produced two pretty good shots. This time he dances down the track early, Botha obliges by tossing it up on middle and leg, and he lofts it with a straight bat over midwicket. He wasn't entirely to the pitch, but he went through with the shot and made good enough connection to clear the short boundary.
and a powerful sweep now, there is cover at deep backward square leg so just the single
Shiv looks to work him to the leg side, and again the ball comes on slowly and he nearly chips it back
Shiv skips out this time, well outside off to get to the pitch of the ball and flick it wide of mid on for one more
Bravo advances again, Botha sees him in time and holds the length back. This time Botha defends.
stays in the crease and quietly flicks the last ball backward of square for one more
Bravo punches the ball towards long-on and ambles across for a single
Peterson launches a low lbw complaint, Chanderpual was looking to sweep that after getting on one knee, struck on the pads outside off
guided towards short third, no run again
tucked towards short fine this time, plenty of calling before it was decided to not go for the single
eases it past a diving Duminy at short midwicket to pick up a leisurely single
not exactly where he intended, looking for a flamboyant carve, ends up sending the ball towards wide long-on
starts with a short of length ball angling in, defended to the leg side
Chanderpaul walks towards the off stump as he defends towards cover
Morkel targetting the top of off, a la McGrath, Chanderpaul walking across the stumps and defends down the track
keeps it around off, Chanderpaul sneaks a single after inside-edging the ball towards midwicket
over the wicket to the right-hander, short of length and heading for off again, blocked by Bravo from the crease
Morkel remains supremely accurate, absolutely no room, keeps pegging away at a short of a length, Bravo defends to the side
overpitched outside off, Chanderpaul shuffles down the track and whips it towards wide long-on, in the air but knew where he was hitting that
on the pads, defended to the leg side
nudges the ball towards midwicket, to the left of the fielder this time
the third six for Bravo, length ball, Bravo sashays down the track and whacks that over long-on, no doubt that was clearing the rope, the Bravos having a fun day so far
square cut towards deep point for a single
blocked back to the bowler to end the over
slogged by Bravo, at least he attempted to slog it, wanted to launch that out of the ground, it takes a top edge and flies towards third man for four, Bravo won't be complaining
worked down to third man for a single
length ball outside off, Chanderpaul gets forward and eases the ball to mid-off to get off the strike, plenty of noise around the ground after Bravo hitting
attempts a bouncer at the body, Bravo ducks under, umpire calls it  a wide as it was down the leg side
reverts to nagging away at offstump, poked towards point
well outside off, Chanderpaul looks to dab it past backward point but can't beat the man
another dot ball to end the over, a length delivery around off, pushed to mid-off, too firmly to get a run
Peterson on the pads, easy for Bravo who whips it towards deep square leg for a couple
fires it down the leg, tucked towards midwicket
clear strategy from Peterson is to not give any width, darting it into the pads every ball, Bravo can't get it away
more legstump bowling, Bravo gets a single towards mid-on

oh my goodness, West Indies can't afford this, Bravo is run-out after an appalling call for a single from Chanderpaul, who had crunched a reverse-sweep to short third man, it went straight to Morne Morkel, no chance of a single there, but Chanderpaul had set off, Bravo responds late, though there was no way he was going to make his ground, the throw is on top of the stumps, AB takes off the bails with Bravo several yards out
length ball outside off, pushed towards mid-off
more confused running from West Indies, Smith inside-edges the ball towards square leg and sets off, sent back after he's down several steps
defended towards the off side off the front foot
Thomas has no clue about the Tahir googly, completely foxed by that one, the ball turned in and cramped him as he was looking for an expansive shot, Thomas barely manages to survive
pushed down the ground to get to the safety of the non-striker's end
flighted ball defended by Chanderpaul to the leg side
big shout for lbw as Chanerpaul goes for a powerful sweep, it was a short ball that he inside-edge to the pads
nudged to square leg for a single
tossed up and that's defended to the bowler
on the pads, tucked behind square for a single

Chanderpaul decides its time to switch gears, a length ball from Peterson, Chanderpaul gets on one knee and looks to swipe that, gets it off the bottom of the bat, several yards wide of the fielder at midwicket
outside off, and that is punched down to long-off for a single
on the pads, worked towards square leg to end the over
Chanderpaul stretaches to get to the pitch and pushes the ball towards mid-off
punched towards short cover, where du Plessis dives to stop that
nudges it to backward square leg
length ball outside off, legspinner, punched to long-off
length ball on off, pushed towards mid-off
'top work that, great over Tahir,' says AB as the final ball of the over is tapped towards square leg
was that a stumping chance? it was fired down the leg side and Thomas was out of his crease, that went through AB's legs for wides
whipped to wide long-on, and sprinted to get the second
on the pads again, tucked behind square leg
length ball outside off, worked towards midwicket by Chanderpaul
length ball on off, blocked to the off side
Thomas gets on the back foot and seemed to be off balance when he played a late cut, but he has played it well enough to pick up a boundary past third man
West Indies showing its not all about power, Chanderpaul this time, making room and playing a superbly timed lofted, inside-out drive past long-off for four more
spoke too soon, that's the end of Chanderpaul, he was looking to play another lofted inside-out hit, hoping to clear the extra cover fielder, instead he can only find long-off
punched to long-on this time for a couple
another googly, and Thomas has no idea about that one either, misses the bat by a long way and is struck on the pads, Tahir launches a loud appeal, that was sliding down
crunched towards short cover, sharp fielding there prevents a run
another authoritative hit from Thomas, along the ground to deep square leg, placement isn't great
length ball on off, defended towards the off side
short of length ball that is jabbed down to long-on

Humongous appeal for lbw against Pollard first ball, umpire says not out, and signals leg byes, referral it is, pitching on outside off and hitting on off and middle, Hawk-Eye suggest that was going on to hit middle, height is not a problem either, replays take a while to check whether there was any bat on it, there wasn't, Pollard gone for a golden duck, Smith will be very pleased with the way his bowling changes have worked today
short of length, punched towards mid-off by Sammy, who will now have to deliver the big hits for West Indies
on middle and leg, muscled towards mid-on, too firmly to get a single
end of a stunning over from Steyn, on a length and in the channel outside off, defended to short cover
gets the outside edge towards short third man
pushed back down the track
just outside off, blocked to the off side
on middle stump, blocked towards the bowler again
five dot balls, taps it to the on side, superb over from Tahir so far

and a superb over gets even better, Thomas losses his head and his wicket, looks to scythe a length ball over the off side, Duminy runs back from extra cover to pouch the catch that gives Tahir his fourth wicket, a debut to remember for Tahir, and some really poor cricket from West Indies

Steyn gets another, that's one more duck, Sammy and Pollard were supposed to provide the late impetus but both have gone without scoring, Steyn fires in a quick and short ball, it doesn't rise too much, not sure what Sammy was trying, he is struck in front of middle, on the knee roll, and he's on his way, the hitting of Darren Bravo seems a long time ago, West Indies  fighting to bat out the 50 overs
length ball on offstump, defended with exaggerated caution
poked tentatively towards cover
shortish ball outside off, Roach plays inside the line of that one
length ball heading for off, Roach is off the mark as he gets that one down to third man, that was the first run after 14 dot balls
outside off, Benn looks to carve that towards point, bottom-edges it to the off side
Morkel starts with a short of length ball well outside off, left alone by Roach, AB de Villiers didn't collect that one cleanly as it bounces twice before reaching him, a bye is pinched
short of length and angling into middle, defended to the off side off the back foot
a boundary at long last for Wes Indies, a bit of width for Been and he slaps it behind point for four
this one came into Benn who was looking to repeat the previous shot, it sneaks under his bat to the keeper
length ball outside off, Benn's feet don't move an inch as he pushes the ball back to the bowler
short of length ball, on middle and off, squirted away towards square leg
punched back down the track towards mid-off by the batsman
Roach also gets a single, a full toss from Steyn, clipped towards deep square leg

and that's curtains for the West Indies innings, they finish on double Nelson, Benn was looking to sky that one over extra cover, gets far too much elevation and  Morkel runs in to take a sharp catch, he's one of the best outfielders in the game though he's a fast bowler

inn2.comm: speared in from round the wicket, wide of the crease, Amla backs away and looks to cut but can't get it past point
beaten outside off! That's not happened much to Amla recently. Benn gets this one to grip and break from back of a length as Amla goes for a big drive and misses.
back of a length again, Amla stays on the crease and punches into the covers
fuller this time and Amla is away, driving softly wide of mid off for one. Devon Thomas is really loud behind the stumps, "Come on Maaaaan", he yells.
Smith stays on the crease and defends down the track from outside off
beats the inside edge with extra turn as Smith hangs back and misses the cut.
back of a length and coming in with the angle, Amla stays in the crease and punches to the on side
on the toes, Amla flicks fluently behind square for a single

Statutory warning - Don't pitch it on Amla's pads. If you do, he will kill you. Just like that. Roach delivers another half volley, friendly and full, don't mind the pace. Amla happily flicks, this time in front of square and gets the first four of the chase
again that line, but not so full this time and Amla is beaten for pace as he looks to whip. Thuds into the pads and it rolls away for a legbye
over-pitched and angling across Smith, looking for his outside edge, and he goes for the drive. Gets it squarer than he wanted to, and it goes to point
again, very full outside off, Smith looks for the drive though he's not close enough for the shot, and mistimes it

that's the problem for a spinner in the opening overs. He has to be spot on with the line and length. Benn did not give much width, but it was probably a foot shorter than it should have been outside off stump. Amla pounced on it and sent it purring away behind point for four
fuller this time, draws Amla out into the forward defensive push
tossed up on leg, Amla looks to flick but closes the face early and the leading edge goes back to the bowler
Amla pushes to mid off, where Devon Smith converges on it, but is possibly distracted by the keeper's mad yelling. Fumble allows a single which was on, in any case.
turn into Smith this time from just outside off, and he adjusts to defend with the full face.,
flighted on off stump, Smith reaches out to drive but can't time it well enough to beat the bowler
full anf angling in again, Amla drives solidly to mid on

and he nearly gets him with a short ball, that did not quite rise after landing. That came on slower than Amla expected and did not sit up. He went for the pull and nearly mistimed it straight to square leg

Roach has got Amla in slightly controversial fashion. Several things happened there. First up, Roach delivered a snorter of an inducker, accentuated by the fact that he delivered it from wide of the crease. It was always coming in, and then landed on a length outside off before nipping in. Amla was cut in half as he looked to force from the crease, and ended up getting an inner edge that flew low down to the leg side. The keeper Devon Thomas who has been making a lot of noise, pulled a blinder, arresting his momentum and diving low to the left. The umpire asked Amla to wait, to check if Roach over-stepped. The replays suggested it was cut and go. If I were the third ump, I'd have probably said no-ball, but it was deemed legal. WI have struck
yorker first up at 147 kph, this is Caribbean pace at its best! Kallis does well to jam the bat down and keep it out.
short ball now, Kallis goes for the pull and keeps it down to deep backward square leg, for one
back of a length on off stump, Smith gets behind the line and defends compactly.
tossed up on off, Kallis reaches up to smother and defends to the off side
this time he spears into the pads and Kallis works it through midwicket for a couple
tossed up on off, check drive into the covers for a single
this time Kallis gets the single, driving airily into the covers
Smith leans out to cover the line and then works with the spin through midwicket for one

Ladies and gentlemen - we have a game here. Kallis is gone. Lovely bit of bowling from Benn, lands this on a length around middle and leg, and tempts Kallis into the cover drive. Only, Kallis was around half a foot short of the length, and the ball spun like the Indian-made tops you get in Chandni Chowk. Kallis ended up getting an outside edge that flew quick to Sammy at the lone slip. Did it carry? Kallis did not wait for the replays to vindicate it - he just asked Sammy. How good is that to see? Great scenes. This game has come alive.
back of a length and angling across Smith who defends from the crease into the covers

lovely from Smith. Back of a length and on the pads, that was not full enough to be caressed, but Smith still managed to time it without breaking into a sweat. The ball gathers pace as it runs across the Kotla for four.
better line, gets this ti angle across Smith who stays on the crease and defends towards mid off
over-pitched on off this time, and Roach is lucky that Smith mis-timed the off drive.

Roach is getting the ball to talk, and it is currently saying, "I am so near, yet so far to Smith's outside edge". Back of a length, angling across and nipping off the seam, past Smith's tentative poke and through to talkative Thomas.
and a yorker to end the over, thunders in from wide of the crease and Smith does well to protect the feet and work it through square leg for one.

tossed up on off from over the wicket, Smith skips out and works it with the turn through wide mid on. Thomas lets the fielder have a earful as he runs in to field, and he responds by keeping it down to one
AB jumps out, converts it into a fulltoss and eases it past the bowler for a single
almost snuck through an almost non-existent gap between bat and pad as Smith reached out to smother the spin. It was stopped by the base of his backfoot in the end,
Smith gets further out and across, works it with the spin to mid on

Smith makes solid connection with thin air. He had troubles against Harbhajan outside off recently and Benn is doing the same. Tossed up, drifting and looping outside off, Smith drives airily and misses
shorter and flatter, Smith hangs back and defends into the off side

AB you beauty. Back of a length outside off, not the kind of ball normal batsmen will look to score a boundary off. What does AB do? He stays back in the crease. Shapes for a forward defensive. And plays a forward defensive. Only that he middles the defensive push and sends the ball packing across the turf for four.
fuller this time, AB gets forward and defends down the track

AB has played the shot of the day, and followed it up with one that's even better. Both within his first 4 balls. Fuller from Roach, wide outside off, mere batsmen would have flashed without moving feet. Special batsmen like AB get their front foot into the job and just flow with it, essaying a square drive that just seems to  be in perfect synchrony with the order of things in the universe.
back of a length on off stump, and defended

within the space of one over, AB has left this commentator short of words. Another shot that is just a thing of joy. Roach now almost hits the perfect unhittable length outside off. Maybe a foot short of where it should have been. AB stayed on leg stump, opened the wrists, bent the knees and forced it square. Poetic.
on the pads and he easily works it through square leg for one
full on off stump and defended into the off side

AB almost commits suicide. He looks to dominate Benn from the outset, jumping out of the crease and looking to dump him inside out, but Benn cannily drops the length short. AB ends up scooping it without getting to the pitch and it lands just wide of mid off.
gets the single and gets to the non-striker's end. Full on leg stump, almost yorked but he managed to push it to long on for one

Smith escapes a run out chance. Gosh, how did West Indies let that slip? He works it off the pads, very soft hands so it does not go very far. Thomas scurries across, picks up and throws to the bowler's end as Smith looks hopelessly short of completing an impossible single. It misses the stumps and Benn fails to collect. He had enough time, but he did not collect it!
speared into the pads, he looks to pull and misses. Stifled lbw appeal, mostly in hope.
back of a length outside off, he stays back and drives through mid on for one
straight and sure, back of a length on off stump, AB defends down the track.
a foot outside off, AB looks to dab it fine of point, but finds the fielder. They think of a single, can someone tell them they are chasing a small target?

in the middle of the madness, some more class from AB. Bravo lands this in the driving length, AB's hit good balls for four before, this was meat and drink. Gets forward, bends the knee and spanks it with military efficiency through the covers. Crunch.
better lengths, holds it back and forces AB to defend as he covers the line
another one on the spot, coming in off the seam, AB defends to the off side
and again, thats more like it from Bravo and AB deals respectfully. Defended to the off side
full and friendly on middle and leg, Smith drives reluctantly to mid on for one
short of a length and wide of off stump, AB waits for it and dabs it towards third man for a single
smart delivery, offcutter back of a length, working on Smith's patience as he searches for pace on the ball. Ends up defending after coming down the track
similar length but a touch wide outside off and Smith steers it backward of point for one
angled into AB's pads, he nurdles it in front of square to turn the strike again

another one of 'em offcutters, Smith's having problems. Short of a length, grips and turns away as Smith sets himself up for a forcing square drive. The deviation means it hits the outside edge and runs down to third man for one
full delivery outside off, Smith drives without timing into the covers
keeps it back of a length again, AB stays on the crease and defends towards the leg side
slightly fuller and wider, in his current form AB will think he's missed out. Mistimes the cover drive and gets a single

that's the length Smith's been waiting for, and he gets it away for a much-needed boundary. Bravo dangles it temptingly outside off, full and slightly wide. Smith flows into his dominant cover drive, and gets the gap to perfection
slowish offcutter this time, Smith waits and opens the face to run it down towards third man
back of a length again outside AB's off stump, dabbed off the backfoot through backward point for one

that kept low, AB stayed back to a back of length ball that never came on, and punched it straight to mid off. Smith thought there was a single, and if Benn had hit the stumps, he may have been ruing the decision to run halfway down before turning back
two more for AB, stays beside the line of one outside off and guides it effortlessly to deep backward point for a couple
Sammy cuts the width this time, AB just stays back and punches into the covers
Sammy again gives AB just enough width to power the square drive away for a couple. He's looking Ominous with a capital O.
back of a length again outside off and doesn't time it too well as he punches into the covers
fuller delivery to end the over, AB just covers the line and blocks to the off side

ouch, Bravo has slipped on his follow through and looks to be in serious strife. Back of a length on off stump, Smith punches it towards mid on. Bravo thought he could get across and stop it, so tried to arrest his off-side motion on the follow through. He seemed to twist his knee and land clumsily. Break in play and time for some drinks.
short of length ball is swiped in trademark Smith style to midwicket
short of length ball just outside off, defended back to the bowler
slow, full and wide from Pollard, slashed towards cover by AB de Villiers
on the pads, another easy single as Smith tucks the ball to midwicket
angling into AB de Villiers, who taps the ball back to the bowler
whipped towards wide midwicket for a couple to bring up the fifty partnership
on a length, defended back to the bowler
guided the ball to third man for a single, Smith wasn't settled at the start
full and sliding into the pads, Smith tucks it to midwicket
back of a length ball, pushed back to the bowler
full and into the pads, pushed back past the bowler
full ball on offstump, defended to the bowler
full delivery outside off,smother by Smith
length ball outside off, pushed towards mid-off
on the pads, dabbed to mid-on for a single
shortish ball, turns a touch in, AB de Villiers tucks it to square leg
an ungainly swipe from Smith, a misfield at short midwicket from Gayle  allows a hurried single
AB looks to open the face, gets a thick outside edge past the keeper for two, streaky!
works this to midwicket for a single
chops the ball towards the point, straight at the fielder
back of a length, on offstump, pushed towards mid-off
back of a length again, not much movement for Sammy, AB works the ball behind square leg
full on off, punched back to the bowler
that kept low, just outside off, whipped towards square leg, AB sprinted the first, hoping for a second, but Smith decline
thumped off the front foot towards mid-off
length ball on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
faster one from Gayle, AB de Villiers looks to heave that towards midwicket, gets a top edge that loops towards wide mid-off, and lands just wide of Benn
length ball and outside off, pushed towards cover
lovely, what a shot from AB de Villiers, overpitched outside off, he gets a big stride forward and caresses the ball past mid-off
short of a length ball on legstump, played inside out towards extra cover
length ball slanting into the pads, AB de Villiers leans across and pushes it towards mid-on
a touch shorter, carved towards backward point
back of a length ball into legstump again, worked behind square leg for a single
overpitched ball to end the over, Smith punches it to long-on to pick another risk-free single
first ball of the over is short and wide as Smith comes down the track, inside-edged towards mid-on
stands tall and pushes the ball to mid-on for another single, no trouble at all
length ball outside off, poked towards the off side
Smith comes down the ground, lofts the ball towards long-on, not it with much power and it lands safely short of the fielder
on the pads and that is whipped to midwicket
this time Smith plays to midwicket, can't get it past the fielder
wide outside off, carved towards backward point
short of length ball on middle, defended to the off side
length ball on off, driven towards mid-on
shorter this time, and on offstump, pushed towards mid-off for another dot ball
back of a length ball on legstump, worked towards square leg, Pollard somehow has developed the knack of not getting hit, the bowling looks pretty innocuous
on offstump this time, punched back to the bowler who moves to his right to stop that
on the legstump, tucked towards square leg
on the legstump again, worked towards midwicket
on the pads again, clipped behind square leg
Smith set off immediately after punching that ball to mid-off,. AB was slow to respond and he had to put the skates on as the throw came in to the keeper's end
defended to the right of the bowler
AB de Villiers has had enough of nurdling the ball, he charges out and smacks that delivery over wide long-on to bring up his fifty with a flourish
full ball on middle, yorks Smith, who squeezes it out down the pitch
punched down the ground for another easy single
West Indies need the breakthroughs now, these two are finding it very easy, AB pushes the ball towards mid-off and takes one
eases towards long-on, Smith immediately shouts 'Two, two' and they get it
poked towards backward point for another single
another outside edge, Pollard is on his haunches, second time AB has got it past the keeper, very fine as well, that four more for South Africa
a length ball on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
a quick delivery on legstump, Smith is opened up as he defends
on Smith's pads again, worked towards deep backward square leg, where Sarwan sprints across and dives to save his team a couple of runs
more legstump bowling, glanced to fine leg for a single
a loud call of 'Wait in' after Nikita Miller makes a diving stop at backward point
goes for the cut but that ball was far lower than AB expected, he gets down on one knee to try and meet the ball, still can't connect
punched down to long-on for another risk-free single
length ball on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length and just outside off, jabbed towards point by AB
poked to point for a single that brings up the hundred partnership, South Africa coasting along
bends his knee as he square drives a length ball to deep point
slightly loopy delivery from round the stumps, just outside off, driven hard by Smith but a dive from Sammy at short cover stops that one
length ball is defended to cover
short of a length ball just outside off, again AB shows off the bent-knee drive, towards sweeper cover
short of a length this time, outside off, Smith taps it back to the bowler
fuller ball, Smith drags it towards mid-on but can't get the run
back to back of a length, slower ball, 120kmh, defended by Smith
driven down the ground by Smith, all too easy for South Africa here
short of a length from Pollard, patted back to the bowler by AB
once again, AB is content pushing the ball back to the bowler
very short from Pollard, and a bit of width as well, chopped towards sweeper cover
slanting into the pads, for the third time in the over, Pollard fields a push back down the track
short of length ball, Smith looks to cut but is beaten outside off
gets a single to deep square leg
length ball from Benn, pushed towards wide mid-on
hurried on to AB as he looked to cut, pushes it to the off side
gets forward and launches that over short cover for four, lovely timing and placement as well
and that's massive, AB charges out and clubs that cleanly over long-off, well into the stands, this match heading for an early finish
outside off, no flight this time, de Villiers works it towards sweeper cover
on the pads, defended to the left of the bowler who rushes across to field
gentle length delivery from Pollard, pushed to the off side for a single
full ball is drilled by Smith towards mid-off

Pollard sets off on extravagant celebrations, Smith is bowled as he looks to swipe a delivery to the leg side, he plays well outside the line of that one and the ball crashes into off, the breakthrough West Indies desperately needed
Duminy shoulders arms to his first delivery, well outside off
back of a length ball and outside off, defended to the off side
AB looks to slash that one to point but he misses the outside-off ball
Duminy gets a single down to third man
that was a beautiful shot from AB, gets slightly forward and caresses the ball along the ground for four, he's played that several times today
tapped towards mid-on for a single
superb delivery from Roach, a bouncer on legstump, Duminy wasn't sure how to deal with that, bottom hand comes off the bat as he defends awkwardly, the ball pops towards the off side
follows that up with a full ball, that is kept out by Duminy
a single to midwicket to end the Roach over
shortish ball from Pollard, swatted by Duminy with plenty of power, Darren Bravo makes a mess of the fielding at deep midwicket, that's a boundary to start the over
defended to the off side
on leg stump, Duminy gets bat on it to guide it down to fine leg for a couple
defended towards point, and the batsmen scamper a quick single
a length ball is defended to the off side by AB, this is a no-ball for not having enough fielders in the circle
gets on the back foot and eases it to long-on to get an easy single

back of a length ball on off, JP Duminy guides the ball towards backward point, looks at AB to see whether he wants a single, AB is already racing for the run, Duminy sprints as well, and the throw is wide, and all is well for South Africa
short ball from Roach to start, Duminy pulls powerfully to square leg, where the umpire ducks to avoid the ball
overpitched on offstump, driven towards extra cover by AB de Villiers
down the leg side, hits him on the pads, as runs down past the keeper for four leg byes
short and outside off, Duminy stands tall and steers the ball to third man for a single
another short one from Roach, AB looks to power that through the leg side, doesn't quite time it as the ball flies towards square leg
another leg bye to end the over, Roach continue to bowl as Duminy's pads
overpitched, and Duminy works that past mid-on
loopy full delivery outside off, Duminy bends as he lap sweeps that towards short fine
short of a length and outside off, chopped towards point by AB
Duminy guides the ball towards third man and immediately calls for two
eased to the right of the bowler for a single, runs coming too easily for South Africa
short of a length, blocked to the leg side by AB
back of a length, and outside off, pushed towards mid-off
back of length ball that gets the leading edge as the batsman defends, ball pops towards point
short of length ball, on middle and off, tucked towards mid-on by Duminy
that's free runs, down the leg side, off the pads and past a diving wicket keeper for four
de Villiers charges down the ground and flat bats a short ball towards sweeper cover
more orthodox from AB on the last ball before drinks, pushed to long-on for a single
slow through the air, a touch short outside off as AB looks to play the square drive
back of a length outside off and this time he forces it away through point for one
short ball outside JP's off stump, leaves him unable to play the premeditated sweep, and he just adjusts and dabs it backward of point for a single
flighted outside off and AB pushes it into the off side
this time he spears it into the pads and AB turns it through midwicket for a single
on JP's pads and he works it behind square for a single to retain strike
good delivery, back of a length and iniviting the drive, but not quite in the slot, JP still plays it uppishly through mid on for one
AB's driving through the off side has been top drawer today. Another over-pitched offering outside off and he knifes it to the deep for a couple
full-pitched on the stumps, AB drives down the ground for a single towards long on
JP almost seemed to expect the short ball, he was ready for the pull despite coming down the track and to the off side, and then kept it down to deep backward square leg
over-pitched on AB's pads. Well, Sammy seems to have given up. AB flicks through square leg for one
slow and short outside off stump, easily dabbed through point for one more
over-pitched on middle and leg, driven through the covers for a single
drifts onto the pads, JP works it to the leg side, without timing
shorter and tuening in, JP stays back and forces against the spin for a single into the covers
AB dances out, gets to the pitch and drives with the spin through mid off for a single
the floater from Benn, JP plays back, spots the variation and covers the line
again, flat and quick, and it holds its line on off stump. JP defends down the track
AB looks to launch Sammy through the covers, but inside edges onto the boot and they steal a single to the off side
back of a length outside off, JP covers the line and defends to mid off
over-pitched on off, JP drives well but straight to cover
back of a length, JP fends off the back foot behind point
now he gets the single, forcing Sammy through the off side
AB drives into the covers and squeals a single. After a long time, the new keeper makes his voice heard. He loves to yell at mid off, doesn't he.
tossed up outside off, AB stays beside the line and cracks it square for a single
JP skips out, gets to the pitch and works Benn through mid on for another single
over-pitched on off, AB forces through wide mid-off for one
flat and quick outside off, JP stays in the crease and blocks into the covers for one

it had to be the square drive, didn't it. Full delivery outside off, AB gets to the pitch, bends the knee and creams it into the covers for the fastest 100 by a South African in World Cups. It's been an AB delight.
speared down the leg, would have been a wide if JP had let it go, he stabbed it through square leg for one
slow through the air, stops in JP who is early into the punch towards wide mid off
again slow outside off, JP waits and this time gets the single through wide mid off for one
AB comes out to a flat delivery and works it down the ground for one
JP taps an off stump ball towards the covers for one
Gayle is absolutely firing them onto leg stump, AB responds with a forward defensive
again, fast and full on leg stump, AB defends down the track
back of a length outside off, JP rides the bounce and taps into the off side
slow pointless trundle, back of a length outside off, AB slaps into the covers for one more
fuller on off stump, JP forces down the ground but can't get it away
JP rides a short ball outside off and dabs it very late backward of point for a single
Pollard jumps wide of the crease and then angles this down the leg side for AB to glance it along the way to deep fine leg
back of a length outside off, JP waits on the crease and punches through mid off for another single
tossed up on off, JP can't get it away and Thomas yells, "Ohh bowling, bowling bowling..."
same ball, draws JP into the off drive and he can't get it away. Thomas thinks Gayle just bowled the ball of the century.
JP gets this away through the off side, and Thomas cuts short his usual speech, "Ohhh... Oh"
AB gets inside the line and plays with the spin through mid on for a single
JP waits for the spin and then eases into a cover drive, fluent and easy for a couple
JP gets a single to end the over, working down the ground for one
short ball outside off, JP punches into the covers for one
AB gets a short one now and forces it into the covers. Another couple.
AB works him with the spin through midwicket. As he runs across for the penutimate run, he takes the gloves off. JP should finish it off now.
not yet. Cracks a short ball outside off straight to cover
all over. Full-pitched ball outside off and JP's laced it along towards deep extra cover for the winning run. South Africa have stamped their awesomeness all over West Indies today.
